Articles.Content:
Hello,

Is KSP the greatest game or what!! I really enjoy traveling through time to distant planets and the Mun with the Kerbals! They are very entertaining creatures to me, and extremely brave I might add. I picked up a copy of KSP a few months ago, but have really just began my journey out into space in the past recent weeks. I have yet to land any where other than the Mun, and both runways on Kerbin as well, but I continue to try. My last Mission attempt was to see how close I could get to the sun and live to tell about it, but some years into running only on solar power, I moved to 20.2, so I will take that mission with a much upgraded design!

My newest attempts have been weapons!! I was never really into weapon designs in KSP but today I decided to give it a go.. well, something like that!

Have a look, what is this? well, this is... Charlie! Yea, that is what we will call it!

Charlie is an extremely simple design, basically in his infant state currently.

After a few... Unpredictable test results!!

Charlie was sending missiles in no time!! Next area of focus is of coarse, the aim! It is slightly off you could say!

none the less, I really enjoy this game! It is nice to have a break from the shoot it up bang bang live fast, die young, and leave a good looking corpse style game play! And really get out there and explore.

Hello! And welcome to the KSP forums!

The Number 1 Nicest fourm on the planet (Earth, that is)

This is not a opinion, this is a fact, for me at least

You could even add some delta winglets (from the aero tab) at the back, and a little probe core to the top of each and have them be guided

Have fun!
If you put static fins but mount them at a slight angle, they will gyroscopically stabilize your missiles, even without a probe or other guidance.
